intro: Paramignya mindanaensis, commonly known as the Mindanao paramignya, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its woody structure and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
